SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: United Phosphorous Limited has informed the Exchange regarding a press release dated October 10, 2007, which is as follows: "The Company has previously stated that one of its strategies is to grow through acquisitions. At any point of time, we evaluate opportunities for acquisitions and are at this time evaluating a few such opportunities. We are currently evaluating whether to bid to acquire a target that is a major Asia-based company in the agrochemicals sector, of a size substantially similar to us. The target, if acquired, would represent a substantial and material portion of our total assets and revenues on a post-completion basis. We have executed a confidentiality agreement which prohibits us from disclosing details of the target or the competitive bid process. The acquisition process requires us to participate in a competitive bidding situation. There are other bidders for the target and we are in the second round of the competitive bid process for the target. We intend to make a bid for the target shortly. There is no assurance that our bid will be accepted or that we will enter into definitive agreements to acquire the target. Even if we enter into definitive agreements to acquire the target, there is no assurance that the conditions to closing under such agreements will be satisfied, or that we or seller will be able to consummate the acquisition. If we are successful in our bid, we expect to finance the acquisition with the issuance of equity, as well as with cash from operations, our existing cash balances, substantial debt financing, or any combination of these. We can give no assurance that we will be able to arrange financing on acceptable terms, if at all, to complete the acquisition. Due to the significant size of the target, the debt financing for the acquisition could be substantial and significantly increase our and the target's debt leverage. The acquisition of the target may or may not be dilutive to our consolidated earnings. If the acquisition is financed by the issuance of our equity shares, it would dilute the ownership interest of our shareholders".

Soft Callable: (a) 140% of the Accreted  Principal amount for the period on or after February 01, 2007 (1 year and 2 weeks) until January 31, 2008 (both dates inclusive); (b) 135% of the Accreted  Principal amount for the period on or after February 01, 2008 (2 year and 2 weeks) until January 31, 2009 (both dates inclusive); or (c) 130% of the Accreted Principal amount for the period on or after February 01, 2009 (3 year and 2 weeks) until December 07, 2010 (both dates inclusive); (d) In addition, the issuer may redeem  the Series B Bond in whole at the Accreted Principal Amount if the principal amount of the Series Bonds that have not been redeemed, repurchased and cancelled, or converted is equal to less than 10% of the original principal amount of the Series B Bonds. SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: United Phosphorous Limited has informed the Exchange that the company has acquired 100% stake in SWAL (formerly known as Shaw Wallace Agrochemicals Limited) for a consideration of Rs.234 million. The acquisition will be financed through cash accruals of the Company. The Company has further informed that SWAL is engaged in manufacturing, formulation and marketing of agrochemicals and fertilizer mixtures. Its plant is located in Haldia. SWAL's revenue for the year ending March 31, 2005 was approximately Rs.700/- million.  This acquisition will accelerate the consolidation within the domestic agrochemical industry and make UPL the largest player and leader for some of the products. The company's access in markets like Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Kerala and Tamilnadu will increase. This is the first acquisition made by the company in the Indian Market. The business of SWAL will be immediately integrated with UPL.

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: United Phosphorous Limited has informed the Exchange that the Company has purchased CEQUISA, a distributor and registrant of crop-protection products located in Barcelona, Spain. The sale includes all stock and related entities, including the company's assets, products, registrations, and property and rights associated with the business of CEQUISA and its subsidiaries. This acquisition provides the Company with a strong platform to expand and strengthen its presence in Southern Europe and Northern Africa with a broad product portfolio. After considerable growth both organically and acquisitions in USA, the Company has been actively pursuing opportunities for growth in the European Union. The CEQUISA opportunity is in line with this strategic push in Europe. CEQUISA revenue for the year ending 2004 were Euro 19.3 mm and the total cost of acquisition is Euro 11.5 mm. The acquisition will be effective June 07, 2005 and will be integrated into the European organisation of the Company based in UK.
